Author: tolken#2655
Content: Re: new site. Looks clean. My minor critique, and this is a very subjective one, it seems very popular these days but I‚Äôve grown tired of it (super long vertical pages).  I want to personally see the whole thing at a glance, at least as much as possible.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: The first thing I see (on mobile) is ‚ÄúOpen-Source Infrastructure For An Interoperable Blockchain Ecosystem‚Äù in huge bold type. Is that what best describes Komodo? Seems like it describes many other projects.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: If I am still interested after that, I scroll down and see some icons without any key definitions. Nice icons but they don‚Äôt mean anything. Then a full screen listing  ‚Äúscalability, security, interoperability, adaptability‚Äù

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Security ‚Äúbitcoin level security‚Äù that‚Äôs sexy. I want to know more.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Scalability ‚Äúlimitless scalability‚Äù slightly intrigued? Many claim scalability, maybe being slightly more specific, even if not entirely accurate, would be more informative. A theoretical near-term scalability as an example (like 1m tps)

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Interoperability: ‚Äúseamless interoperability‚Äù using the word interoperability to describe interoperability, seems like there could be a more descriptive way to say this.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Adaptability: ‚Äúcontinuous development‚Äù I‚Äôd hope so!  Could we give some indication of how active the development is? Team size, team growth, github activity?

Author: tolken#2655
Content: I know these aren‚Äôt meant to be huge text bubbles, but at the same time this is of course the first thing people see. Making it as potent and concise as possible can help people get it. Regardless, nice work team, great to see progress!

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: @Acura Yeah I have their whitepaper

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: @tolken  Just a reminder, this is an interim web refresh where the main goal was to get updated messaging and minor visual update. Full focus is now on the actual rebranded website where we're introducing a entirely new web experience and incorporating a re-hauled design.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: regarding the header - i agree we could add something stronger here. the challenge is that Komodo is complex, and it's hard to incorporate everything without sounding too high-level marketing speak. But we'll look into this.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Certainly, just wanted to provide some personal feedback. I‚Äôll let the experts parse what‚Äôs best to do üòÉ

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: All feedback is useful for sure.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: we were purposefully keeping those initial descriptions vague as below is the CTA to go to the technology page, which expand on all 4 pillars in great details

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: Looking at it now, it might not be apparent that the CTA below is tied to the pillars above

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: we tried to get the tech related details for continuous development in, but that would impact launch so we're rolling that over to the rebranded site

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: We're thinking of having a dedicated "proof points" section that would aggregate github commits, dedicated solutions and technology landing pages, a dev portal etc.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Vague isn‚Äôt bad I suppose, but it seems the challenge is to ensure they‚Äôre interested to dig deeper. Also it‚Äôs important to consider that the website isn‚Äôt necessarily people‚Äôs first exposure to Komodo (maybe they hear word of mouth, or because of some awesome PR that comes from a successful 1m tps test :P), so it doesn‚Äôt have to say everything at once, but just lead them to what they‚Äôre looking for.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: right that was the goal

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: We do have a few updates already planned for this interim site, but the majority of focus will now be on the rebrand.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: If there are any specific examples of things you've seen that you'd like to see in the new rebranded site, feel free to dm them to me. We're currently building out our requirements list to drive a new sitemap.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Just made me think of a cool visual to show scalability. It could be a chain with green orbs flying around in the link, and it gets more and more intense and then a second chain spawns out of it kind of like a DNA strand splitting. and now they both have green orbs flying around (but less intense) and some orbs flying between the chains, and when it gets more intense it splits again etc.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: to show how when the transaction amount gets too large on a chain, a scaling chain spawns and handles some of the load, but the two chains are next to one another and transactions (the green orbs) can move between the chains

Author: Audo#5667
Content: we really need to push a better elevator pitch, often we are still described as a Zcash fork

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
On our explorer we give this explanation about Komodo:

**What is Komodo?**

End-to-end Blockchain Solutions Provider empowering developers to build freely and participate in creating the largest open blockchain network.

Komodo Platform strives to accelerate the adoption of blockchain technologies around the globe and to lead the world in blockchain integration. All of the Komodo‚Äôs unique and cutting-edge technologies are open-source and available to everyone.

With a collaborative approach, rather than a competitive one, Komodo Platform is working to unite the blockchain industry, empower business leaders and entrepreneurs, and eliminate the need for centralized third parties in financial transactions.

Author: joe2x4#5987
Content:
"Komodo is an opensource blockchain, tool kit suite, and protocol that is used in the interconnected open blockchain network." 

My explanation in one sentence. I'm defining komodo in the scope of a larger umbrella network called IOBN in this instance. Just my 2¬¢

Author: joe2x4#5987
Content: In other words we should properly define /name that overall network/forest/universe komodo is creating and use that to help define komodo

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: I have an idea if you guys are game

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Basically 2FA for international flights

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Currently passports use rfid chips that have your personal info in it.  The idea is this in conjunction with their current method of swiping and comparing .  When the passport gets swiped the system sends a coin from host country / confederation account to visiting country  address with encrypted hash of the encrypted rfid chip info.   it provides a way of tracking . When a person enters and exits a country .

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: its just a general idea,   im not sure of the low level aspects of blockchain for feasibility.   Another way of doing it, would be AssetsCC,  where each asset is just one token which corresponds to a passport,  tokens name can be the hash.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: The standard use case gov sees for blockchain is tracking/verifying info. Hashing docs and storing them on a chain, or a variation of that. I'm willing to bet that will be the most common application type, and definitely one of the easiest or most useful. Depends again, if Komodo or one of the 3rd parties here wants to try and build something to pitch.

Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: I think they‚Äôre getting more into facial recognition these days. Most likely your address will simply be your face.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Yea but considering the proposals that solve certificate, license, attestations issues related to issuing and verification and storage maintenance, it's most likely they aren't looking for this to track people, but to track and prove the legitimacy of official government documents that are issued.
